item.title: To a Caveman Very Few Things Are Resources
item.description:

https://nav.al/caveman
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

To a Caveman Very Few Things Are Resources

Dec 13 2021

There was a time when coal wasn’t a resource

Brett: There was a story on ITV in the U.K. talking about how much supposed waste Amazon produces, that Amazon was routinely destroying a whole bunch of products.

item.title: Knowledge Makes the Existence of Resources Infinite
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/infinite-resources
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Knowledge Makes the Existence of Resources Infinite

Dec 10 2021

We’re going to keep creating new knowledge and new resources

Brett:

Knowledge is the thing that makes the existence of resources infinite. The creation of knowledge is unbounded. We’re going to keep on creating more knowledge and, thereby, learning about more and different resources.

item.title: Free Markets Provide the Best Feedback
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/feedback
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Free Markets Provide the Best Feedback

Dec 3 2021

The alternative is feedback from whomever has the most guns

Naval:

Marc Andreessen summarizes this nicely as “strong opinions, loosely held.”

item.title: Ideas Are the New Oil
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/ideas
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Ideas Are the New Oil

Nov 17 2021

All the new fortunes are created with ideas

Naval:

Humans have a history of conquest because we fight for the same exact resources, but even in human history the first explorers were traders. They were going out there to find spices, gold, silk, new plants to domesticate, new animals.

Price Discrimination: Charge Some People More

You can charge people for extras based on their propensity to pay

Nivi: Are there any other microeconomic concepts, outside of zero marginal cost of replication and scale economies, that are important to understand?

Get podcast

  • Apple
  • Breaker

  • Spotify
  • YouTube
  • Download

Nivi: We spoke earlier about picking a business model that has leverage from scale economies, network effects and zero marginal cost of replication. There were a few other ideas on the cutting-room floor that I want to go through with you. The first one is the principal-agent problem.

Product Leverage is Egalitarian

The best products tend to be available to everyone

Naval:
Labor and capital are much less egalitarian, not just in the inputs, but in their outputs.

item.title: The Foundations Are Math and Logic
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/math-logic
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

The Foundations Are Math and Logic

Apr 5 2019

Mathematics and logic are the basis for understanding everything else

Naval:

Foundational things are principles, they’re algorithms, they’re deep seated logical understanding where you can defend it or attack it from any angle. And that’s why microeconomics is important because macroeconomics is a lot of memorization, a lot of macro bullshit.

item.title: Free Markets Are Intrinsic to Humans
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/free-markets
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Free Markets Are Intrinsic to Humans

Mar 5 2019

We use credits and debits to cooperate across genetic boundaries

Naval: Overall capitalism [meaning free markets] is intrinsic to the human species. Capitalism is not something we invented. Capitalism is not even something we discovered. It is in us in every exchange that we have.

item.title: Make Abundance for the World
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/ethical-wealth
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Make Abundance for the World

Mar 3 2019

Wealth isn’t about taking something from somebody else

Naval: I think there is this notion that making money is evil, right? It’s rooted all the way back down to “money is the root of all evil.” People think that the bankers steal our money. It’s somewhat true in that, in a lot of the world, there’s a lot of theft going on all the time.

item.title: American Fall
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/american-fall
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

American Fall

Oct 18 2016

This is a sequel. Read [American Spring](American Spring) first.

“We conclude that the concentration of wealth is natural and inevitable, and is periodically alleviated by violent or peaceable partial redistribution. In this view all economic history is the slow heartbeat of the social organism, a vast systole and diastole of concentrating wealth and compulsive recirculation.”

item.title: The returns to entrepreneurship
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/the-returns-to-entrepreneurship
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

The returns to entrepreneurship

Nov 9 2009

I was at dinner the other night with a group of entrepreneurs. One told the story of a 27-year-old whiz kid whose company will likely exit for $500M – $1B – the business now being less than two years old. You can imagine the effect that this had on the brilliant, hardworking 35+ entrepreneurs in the group, who have had their share of hits, but not at that magnitude and not that quickly.

item.title: Keynes on the Currency
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/there-is-no-subtler-surer-means-of-overturning-the-existing-basis-of-society-than-to-debauch-the-currency-the-process-engages-all-the-hidden-forces-of-economic-law-on-the-side-of-destruction-and-it-do
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Keynes on the Currency

Feb 26 2008

There is no subtler, surer means of overturning the existing basis of society than to debauch the currency. The process engages all the hidden forces of economic law on the side of destruction, and it does it in a manner which not one man in a million is able to diagnose.

item.title: Securitize Citizenship!
item.description:
中文版本

https://nav.al/securitize-citizenship
https://x.com/naval/status/1002103360646823936

Securitize Citizenship!

Nov 29 2005

People hate immigration and immigrants as it’s seen as competing with newcomers over finite resources in a zero-sum game. This argument is flawed on many economic levels, but let’s overlook that for a moment. Let’s give everyone a stake.
